body:
**How this date has been worked out**

The expiry date of your conviction is based on:

* the information you’ve provided 
* the current law on when cautions and convictions expire

This table shows the information you provided, which was used to work out the expiry date. If you entered any incorrect information, the expiry date will be incorrect.

 | | |
|---|---|
| Criminal record type | **Conviction**|
| Type of conviction | **Motoring** |
| Name of conviction | **Disqualification** |
| Age at time of caution | **Over 18** |
| Date conviction given | **17 March 2018**|
| Date conviction ended | **17 March 2019** |

—

components.html: If you need to change any information, or if you have another caution or conviction you’d like to check, [use the service again](/).

heading: Your conviction expired on 17 March 2019
lede: You do not need to tell anyone about this conviction unless an [exception applies](https://www.gov.uk/exoffenders-and-employment?#when-employers-still-need-to-know-about-your-conviction).
